desc: here is it; we are looking for a movesense developer. We already have this developer kit (search it on web). We need to produce an app for Movesense that transmits heart rate and temperature in real time to a deshboard like this attached (left and center diagram). Upgrades via bluetooth must take place every 5 seconds. The app must be able to configure a trigger when the heart rate, and the temperature, exceeds or falls below a certain threshold. Then you will need to be able to configure: "HR - maximum threshold:" "HR - minimum threshold:" "Temp - Maximum Threshold:" "Temp - minimum threshold:" When one of these events occurs, the client thats Movesense is connected, will have to call back a user-defined http URI (via curl, wget, as you like) in the background. You can use any technology you feel most essential as you wish. The client can be for Windows, or for Android, or for IOS. How do you feel appropriate. Just, you have to first specify which programming language you will use. All source code will be issued, which will have to be well commented in English.

desc: Hello.My name is Ian and I have had a game produced many years ago but I got frustrated with the graphics that I got. In short I put the game on ice despite knowing the game after I played it was fantastic and very addictive. But I could not launch it due to sub standard graphics. To give you some idea how long I have sat on it. Smart phones were not out at the time iQubes was produced. Much to do with it was smart phones were coming out with a different league of game play & graphics. So, I thought I would wait until I found some one who could migrate it to smart phones with fantastic graphics as you see today with titles such as candy crush.My game is a little like Candy but much better and more intelligent like Tetris but a leap forward. To give you some idea of the game play. Imagine Tetris merged with Candy crush with a sprinkle of chess. ( As in thought process)The game works on the old Sony erricson and it has been sort of migrated to the iPhone but very rough. So it's a copy of the game but upgraded graphics, very upgraded graphics!There are many functions such as local and global leaderboards. The ability to challenge others... But most importantly there will be a large cash prise for the person with the highest number of challenges won and top scores.
title: iQubes The $1,000,000 puzzle -- 2

desc: A little about the Startup:At the moment it's an idea of the Startup of the cartoon with great potential! At the beginning, there is no budget, so payment will be based on the result (first profit). But I guarantee the payment of labor, everything will be legally certified if necessary. Perhaps we will go together to present the idea in the US (paying expenses are on me). Also it is possible to create IOS,Android game applications before contract conclusion with a cartoon studio.If you do not want to take part in the Startup, but you want to get a fixed amount for drawing the characters, then we will also be able to agree.And now more about the work itself:There are sketches of 8 characters. The task of the project includes:- Detailed drawing of 2D characters- Creation of minimal animation for these characters (characteristic for each one, for example "chuckle", "embarrassment", "madness", etc.)- Experience is welcome, but not required. desc: We have a device which will send WebRTC based video information, for a call. It'll be one way video call, the Android app will only be receiving the video. The issue is that the received video via WebRTC will be H264 encoded. There is no readily available support for H264 decoding in Android for WebRTC. There are as such H264 decoders available in Android, but I am not sure how to integrate them into WebRTC in conjunction.Basically, what we have is a webpage which can receive video call using WebRTC with H264 codec. The same needs to be done in Android.
